alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 26 at 12:56AM CST until January 27 at 9:15AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CST SATURDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL GRUNDY AND SOUTHWESTERN WILL COUNTIES... At 1256 AM CST, emergency management reported an ice jam on the Kankakee River near Wilmington broke, causing flash flooding in Wilmington. Emergency management reported a rise of three feet in river levels in the past hour, with some evacuations reported near Highway 53 and Bridge Street. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from an ice jam. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of areas near the ice jam. The flood wave is moving down the Kankakee River from Wilmington to Phelan Acres. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Warning means rapid-onset flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along creeks, drainage ditches, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. During flooding, rapidly-moving water in drainage ditches, culverts, and detention ponds are especially unsafe and banks may quickly erode. Stay away or be swept away.
